items.title: Dall’AI Generativa agli Autonomous Agent: perché il modello non basta più
items.summary:
La transizione dall’AI generativa passiva alla Agentic AI sta ridefinendo il modo in cui le aziende progettano automazioni e processi intelligenti. Non basta più un LLM ben istruito: serve un’architettura software capace di orchestrare agenti, strumenti e flussi complessi. Dal modello single-agent alle reti multi-agente, il vero valore nasce dalla capacità di strutturare responsabilità, controllo e affidabilità

items.author: Veronica Balocco

items.title: Come gli evals stanno guidando l’introduzione dell’AI nelle imprese
items.summary:
Sempre più aziende integrano l’intelligenza artificiale nei processi, ma molte faticano a ottenere i risultati sperati. Il motivo spesso risiede nella mancanza di sistemi di valutazione adeguati. Secondo OpenAI, gli evals trasformano obiettivi astratti in criteri misurabili, aiutando le organizzazioni a definire qualità, ridurre errori e massimizzare il ritorno sull’investimento

Secondo il rapporto Q2 2025 di Coveware by Veeam, il pagamento medio per attacco ransomware ha raggiunto 1,13 milioni di dollari, un incremento del 104%...

L'uso dell'intelligenza artificiale nel giornalismo è ormai realtà: il 9% degli articoli statunitensi presenta elementi AI-generati. Testate come Associated Press e Axios sperimentano modelli ibridi, mantenendo supervisione umana. Restano aperti nodi su copyright, trasparenza e impatto occupazionale della tecnologia
L'articolo <a href="https://www.agendadigitale.eu/cultura-digitale/giornalismo-aumentato-come-lai-sta-cambiando-le-redazioni/">Giornalismo aumentato: come l'AI sta ca
items.author: Maurizio Carmignani

items.title: Digital omnibus, la sfida di aiutare le aziende senza affossare i diritti
items.summary:
Il Digital Omnibus interviene su dati, privacy, IA e cybersicurezza. Dalla revisione della definizione di dato personale alle eccezioni per categorie particolari e watermarking, l’Europa tenta di semplificare senza scivolare verso una deregolamentazione di fatto. Ci riuscirà?
L'articolo <a href="https://www.agendadigitale.eu/sicurezza/privacy/digital-omnibus-la-sfida-di-aiutare-le-aziende-senza-affossare-i-diritti/">Digital omnibus, la sfida di aiutare le aziende senza affossare i diri
items.author: Rocco Panetta

items.title: Elon Musk’s Grok AI tells users he is fitter than LeBron James and smarter than Leonardo da Vinci

items.author: Josh Taylor

items.title: Ofcom at risk of losing public trust over online harms, says Liz Kendall
items.summary: Technology secretary fears digital frontier may be outpacing regulator, with AI chatbots a particular concernThe UK’s internet regulator, Ofcom, is at risk of losing public trust if it fails to use its powers to tackle online harms, the technology secretary, Liz Kendall, has said.Kendall last week told Ofcom’s chief executive, Melanie Dawes, she was deeply disappointed at the pace of the regulator’s enforcement of parts of the Online Safety Act, which is intended to protect the
items.author: Robert Booth UK technology editor

items.title: Roundtables: Surviving the New Age of Conspiracies
items.summary: Everything is a conspiracy theory now. MIT Technology Review’s series, “The New Conspiracy Age,” explores how this moment is changing science and technology. items.title: Designing digital resilience in the agentic AI era
items.summary: Digital resilience—the ability to prevent, withstand, and recover from digital disruptions—has long been a strategic priority for enterprises. With the rise of agentic AI, the urgency for robust resilience is greater than ever. Agentic AI represents a new generation of autonomous systems capable of proactive planning, reasoning, and executing tasks with minimal human intervention. As…

items.title: Why IT Admins Choose Samsung for Mobile Security
items.summary:
Ever wonder how some IT teams keep corporate data safe without slowing down employees? Of course you have.
Mobile devices are essential for modern work—but with mobility comes risk. IT admins, like you, juggle protecting sensitive data while keeping teams productive. That’s why more enterprises are turning to Samsung for mobile security.

items.title: APT24 Deploys BADAUDIO in Years-Long Espionage Hitting Taiwan and 1,000+ Domains
items.summary:
A China-nexus threat actor known as APT24 has been observed using a previously undocumented malware dubbed BADAUDIO to establish persistent remote access to compromised networks as part of a nearly three-year campaign.
"While earlier operations relied on broad strategic web compromises to compromise legitimate websites, APT24 has recently pivoted to using more sophisticated vectors targeting
items.author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

items.title: SEC Drops SolarWinds Case After Years of High-Stakes Cybersecurity Scrutiny
items.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has abandoned its lawsuit against SolarWinds and its chief information security officer, alleging that the company had misled investors about the security practices that led to the 2020 supply chain attack.
In a joint motion filed November 20, 2025, the SEC, along with SolarWinds and its CISO Timothy G. Brown, asked the court to voluntarily
